medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's growth was normal until 9 months of age, when the weight was found to be 7.0 kg (10th percentile), down from 7.1 kg (27th percentile) at the last visit. At 12 months of age, weight decreased further to 7.3 kg (6th percentile). Despite a nutritional shake intervention, weight gain was inadequate. At 19 months, the weight was 7.4 kg (<1st percentile). The patient experienced intermittent vomiting approximately once a week, which the mother attributed to overeating. The child had a strong appetite and appeared active.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was hospitalized during infancy for influenza and at 16 months of age for bronchiolitis. No other relevant medical history specified.
medical_history.family_history: The patient’s mother was healthy, her brother had attention deficit–hyperactivity disorder, and her father's medical history was unknown.
medical_history.social_history: The patient moved from Puerto Rico one month prior to admission and was living with her mother, 5-year-old brother, and step-grandmother in an urban area of New England. No other specific social history mentioned.
